title: GRS March - Data Visualisation Workshop
description: Graduate Research Week in March 2022 featured a workshop on Data Visualisation, really an introduction to ggplot
contents:
The new model for delivering modules to our postgraduate students means block booking three weeks every year when we down our regular research tools and focus on broader research skills together. Data Visualisation was the topic for the 2nd year postgrads for the Wednesday of this week. And this meant ggplot.
The day-long workshop was split in to 6 sections, all the way from Why R and ggplot to looking at colours, facets, fonts and themes in the afternoon. It was a lot of fun to deliver, even if I’d have preferred face-to-face (and apparently the next iteration in July will indeed be F2F). We had about 50 students engaged, almost all of whom were successful with the raft of shinyapps exercises we put together using learnr.
All the workshop material is available at https://grs-2022.netlify.app/, well except for most of the shinyapps which I’ll take offline at some stage.

title: Final Year Projects
description: I've run a series of final year projects with pharmaceutical science students, this page gives the titles going back over the years.
contents:
I’m also involved in final year projects with the pharmaceutical science students. These have been:
2021
The Wider Impact of COVID19 on Public Health in Ireland
The Genomics of SARS-coranavirus-2
The Association of Telomere Length and Schizophrenia Related SNP’s

2020
Investigation of Breast Cancer Pharmacogenomics Data using the PharmcoGx Bioconductor Package
Single Cell RNASeq Analysis of Transciptomic Data using the scrattch Package

2019
Association of Tuberculosis and HIV in Africa

2018
Investigation of Breast Cancer Pharmacogenomics Data using the PharmcoGx Bioconductor Package
Investigation of Autism Genes by Examining Gene Expression across Different Areas of Healthy Brains
Predict whether a Cancer is Benign or Malignant using the Wisconsin Breast Cancer Diagnostic Dataset

2018
Investigation of Schizophrenia Genes by Examining Gene Expression across Different Areas of Healthy Brains
Classification of Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia using R Programming Techniques

2017
Asthma Clinical Trial Machine Learning using the CAMP Dataset

2016
T-Cell Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia Microarray Sample Classification using R Programming Techniques
Computer Simulation of Heat Integration of Process Streams in the Styrene Process using UniSim430
Computer Simulation of Heat Integration of Process Streams in the Propylene Glycol Process using UniSim430

title: Computer Measurement Systems
description: I teach computer instrumentation to 2nd year bioanalysis students
contents:
We use LabVIEW from National Instruments to make virtual instruments. Some of the laboratory assignments we do can be seen here
The labs include:
making a LabVIEW thermometer and measuring the rise time of a thermocouple
examining the frequency spectrum of various sounds
verifying Nyquist Theorem and observing the effects of signal aliasing
using USB to connect an oscilloscope to a LabVIEW programme
PID control of a tank fill system

title: Manufacturing Technology
description: The chemical engineering element of pharmaceutical science.
contents:
I teach Manufacturing Technology to 4th Year Pharmaceutical Science students. This involves lots of chemical engineering, and my favourite part which is crystallography. The chemical engineering part looks at material balances, heat exchangers, and distillation columns. In crystallography, we go the way from Bravais Lattices, to Miller Indices, Space Groups, and X-ray Diffraction.
The laboratory component of this module uses a Process Simulator programme UniSim490 from Honeywell. We use this to set up virtual processes and compare their operation to theory. Examples of the labs from 2019 are given here.

title: Principles of Physics for Sports Science
description: I teach physics to first year sports science.
contents:
I teach physics to 1st Year Sports Science students. This is primarily biomechanics; kicking-off with linear motion, then progressing to circular motion, before finishing with a section on vectors.
During COVID19 lockdown we put together a series of online experiments for the students. These can be seen here. They use simulations from PHET Colorado

title: NHSr Workshop - Introduction to ggplot
description: A one day workshop on data visualisation delivered to the NHSr Community
contents:
This is a one day workshop delivered to NHSr in January 2021. We covered the basics of ggplot, different geoms for distributions and relationships, colours, fonts, facets, and some special examples like networks and maps.
The slides are available here and the video is available here. The format was inspired by a course on xaringan xaringan, basics and beyond given by Silvia Canelon.
I find that the NHSr have a veritable trove of material; their youtube channel is at NHSr Community Videos, and their sie is at NHSr Commnuity.
